problem.markdown:
Now suppose that the part must undergo two operations, first at machine \(M_1\) and then at machine \(M_2\). Both operations take one minute and both have a probability 0.1 of causing a defect. If both operations are successful, the value of the part is $10,000+2($500). If either operation is bad the value of the part is 0.
No inspection is taking place, and no parts are removed due to being defective.
>>What is the expected value of a part when it leaves the shop? <<
= 8910 [explanation] The probability that a part gets through both operations successfully is \((1-0.1)^2\). Similarly to the first part of the problem, the value of the part is $10,000+2($500) with the probability of \((1-0.1)^2\) and 0 with the probability of \(1-(1-0.1)^2\). There for the expected value is \(($10,000+2($500))(1-0.1)^2\). [explanation]
>>What is the expected increase of a part's value due to both operations?<<
= -1090 [explanation] The expected value of the part has therefore increased by \(($10,000+2($500))(1-0.1)^2-$10,000\). [explanation]
>>What is the production rate of good parts?<<
= 0.81 [explanation] The production rate of good parts is (1-0.1)^2 parts per minute since the operation time is 1 minute per part. [explanation]
